text: Any delays in the process, e.g. waiting on notarization, are prone to issues like this. Sascha, can we make versions.json manually updated rather than automatically? Then it can just be done as part of the release process, when we know that the available binaries are what we expect them to be.

text:
> Sascha, can we make versions.json manually updated rather than automatically? Then it can just be done as part of the release process, when we know that the available binaries are what we expect them to be.
Yeah, sure. If it can't wait until tomorrow, remove L5-6 here: <https://github.com/SaschaMann/Julia-versions.json/blob/main/.github/workflows/build-versions-file.yml>

Then you can trigger it through the Actions tab. Otherwise I'll remove the scheduled build in the morning

text: Yeah for sure, no time constraints on my end, but also probably not even necessary if we can't rely on ACLs...

text:
Disabled the scheduled builds for now, they're causing more harm than good it seems. I'll try to properly fix this post v1.6 as I mentioned before.

You can either trigger it as part of the process through the website or I'll do it once I see the announcement. Sorry for all the hassle with this
